Def.Name: Showy Mountain-Ash
Def.Description: Small tree, growing to 15' - 30' tall with a fairly rounded crown. The trunk can grow up to 12" in diameter.
Def.Leaves: Pinnately compound; leaflets, 11 - 15, 1 1/4" - 2 3/4" long, more than 1/3 as wide, bluish green. Shorter and more rounded at the base than American Mountain-Ash.
Def.Twigs: Winter buds are shiny and sticky.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Pome, in loose clusters that ripin in August and September.
Def.Bark: Smooth with dots when young becoming, grayish brown and developing cracks, splits and scaly patches.
Def.Remarks: The leaves are poisonous, but the berries can be eaten most often as jelly.
